title: OnOptions
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Michelle Obama says friendships are as important as college degrees, job titles, and salary: ‘You’ve got to be really smart and selective about who you let in’
items.description: The former first lady says it’s important to make new friends, but advises people to be picky about who they let stick around. Longtime duos, like Opr...

items.title: The workplace just got even less friendly for LGBTQ+ workers
items.description: This week, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission rescinded its guidance on workplace harassment, in a move that could significantly undermine pr...

items.title: Thousands of travelers may have to pay extra fees at the airport next week
items.description: Traveling soon? If you’re planning on flying domestically, starting February 1, which is next Sunday, you may have to pay an extra fee at airports acr...

items.title: How America’s WHO exit could affect flu shots, outbreaks, and future pandemics
items.description: The U.S. is no longer part of the World Health Organization. After the Trump administration declared its intention to pull the country out of the glob...

items.title: Dr Pepper used a TikTok creator’s jingle. Now everyone wants to get in on the act
items.description: For the first time in Dr Pepper’s 140-year history, the brand is the second-most-popular soda in America. Now it has a shiny new jingle to match. In l...

items.title: Fernando Mendoza Might Save LinkedIn
items.description: The Indiana quarterback has been active on the platform since winning the national championship.

items.title: Experts Are Warning That  ‘AI Swarms’ Could Spark Disruptions to Democracy
items.description: Artificial intelligence is a powerful business tool, but also packs the potential for serious civic harm.

items.title: Not a Single Woman Made This List of 100 Highest Paid Athletes. Here’s How They’re Responding
items.description: Elite female athletes are continuing to make their own opportunities off the court and the field.

items.title: The U.S. has ‘escalation dominance’ in a debt war: Europe would face a violent market crash if it dumps Treasuries
items.description: Europe accounts for about a third of U.S. government bonds held overseas, or roughly 10% of the overall Treasury market.

items.title: Meet the Founder Whose OpenAI-Powered Startup Just Hit $100 Million in ARR
items.description: Leveraging AI, Clay CEO Kareem Amin turned GPT-powered agents into a ‘customer acquisition machine.’

items.title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Is Facing an Unexpected Backlash From Businesses
items.description: Politicians, companies, and the general public are all unhappy with ICE’s actions.

items.title: IMF chief sees global GDP growth as ‘beautiful but not enough’ to handle ‘the debt that is hanging around our necks’
items.description: Governments need to take care of “those who are falling off the wagon," Kristalina Georgieva said on a panel discussion in Davos.

items.title: Trump cancels Puerto Rico solar project designed to help 30,000 low-income families in rural areas
items.description: Javier Rúa Jovet, public policy director for Puerto Rico’s Solar and Energy Storage Association, disputed the Trump rationale for the move.

items.title: Inside NBA House, the league’s big bet on wooing European fans

items.title: As Winter Storm Fern barrels in, all eyes are on the Weather Channel. Its CEO is charting the company’s next big forecast: growth
items.description: CEO Rohit Agarwal says hype and scaremongering amid a dangerous storm are counter-productive when the company is building its business based on trust.
